newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek stocks climb 1.02 pct, industrials pursued.
newsitem.headline: Greek stocks climb 1.02 pct, industrials pursued.

text.p: Greek shares continued to move ahead on Friday with industrials spearheading the market's 1.02 percent rise. Brokers said buying outstripped offers in that sector.
"Blue chip industrials, especially cement, were hotly chased by both domestic and foreign players but limited offer lifted prices considerably," said Alexis Panagiotopoulos, broker at InterSec.
"The broader market remains dull around current levels and in recent sessions the index has settled higher because of late buying in blue chips," he added.
Another leg of this year's rally was not ruled out, but for the time being the market relied on low offer sizes rather than widespread buying interest.
"The market has turned out stronger than expected over the past week or so, but this is mostly based on thin offer rather than broadly-based buying," Panagiotopoulos said.
"Market sentiment is positive and earlier year-end targets for the benchmark index in the 2,000 region are still clearly in sight," he added.
The Athens general index added 1.02 percent or 16.14 points to 1,591.44 from Thursday's 1,575.30 close, with industrials leading the market with a 1.87 percent ascend.
Banks and construction advanced 0.88 and 0.64 percent respectively.
Turnover reached 13.5 billion drachmas on volume of 3.7 million shares.
